abstract: Peter Thiel, the technology entrepreneur and venture capitalist, tells CNBC why he is giving $100,000 to 24 young adults to stop going to school and start focusing on building the tech companies of tomorrow.
snippet: Peter Thiel, the technology entrepreneur and venture capitalist, tells CNBC why he is giving $100,000 to 24 young adults to stop going to school and start focusing on building the tech companies of tomorrow.
lead_paragraph: Peter Thiel, the technology entrepreneur and venture capitalist best known for being an early backer of Facebook, is giving $100,000 to 24 young adults to stop going to school and start focusing on building the tech companies of tomorrow. In an interview with CNBC, Mr. Thiel explains the motivations behind his pledge and talks about the more than 400 people who have applied for the initial round of grants.

headline.main: Peter Thiel Tells Why He Will Pay You to Drop Out of School
